That’s part of the reason why the existentialists and the phenomenologists both say “don’t

Why?
Because if you do that and twist up the structures that you are using to interpret the world

And if horror is all that is always being revealed to you, you will not stay good because

You will get bitter and resentful.
Everything will fall apart around you because you’re not actually modeling the reality

You will fail and become resentful.

Then you’ll be looking for someone to hurt and you’ll have plenty of justification

And worse, and this is Jungian contribution to this idea, this won’t happen all at once,

But the consequence of iterating that across time, say three hundred decisions, is that
you can build yourself into the sort of monster that you would never want to see in the mirror.
And one of the things the phenomenologists would also tell you, and this is something
Jung said as well, is “that is the sort of monster that you probably are”.
If you want to deal with that, you have to start taking things seriously.
There are two things you have to take seriously.

The final consequence of that would be that your health, the health of your family and

The way the world moves is the sum total of the decisions that all of us are making, all

Those things echo like ripples in a pond so when you do some little crooked thing that
